costRules.rationale: Flood hazard typically increases elevation, floodproofing, and insurance requirements.
Higher seismic design categories increase detailing, connections, and review cycles.
Poor drainage can require dewatering, drying time, and subgrade treatment.
Higher clay content increases shrink-swell risk and slab control requirements.
Steep terrain drives cut/fill, erosion control, and potential retaining structures.
Fire-prone areas can add premium for materials, defensible space, and insurance.
Higher wind demand can increase lateral detailing and cladding anchorage scope.
Snow exposure can increase roof framing demand and snow management provisions.
Environmental constraints often add studies, mitigation, and permitting duration.
Utility extension and capacity upgrades can add both direct cost and lead time.
Complex jurisdictional review pathways can increase preconstruction and carrying costs.
Constrained access can drive haul inefficiency, temporary works, and staging costs.

sdc.title: Run structural scheme check for seismic detailing

soil-drainage.title: Plan dewatering and wet-weather earthwork strategy

clay.title: Issue geotech RFI for shrink-swell and slab recommendation

site-slope.title: Quantify cut/fill and retaining wall options

wildfire-risk.title: Confirm fire code and insurer material requirements

wind-load-proxy.title: Validate wind criteria against structural basis of design

snow-load-proxy.title: Review roof snow strategy and drainage assumptions

wetland-constraint-proxy.title: Screen environmental constraints and permitting triggers

utility-capacity-proxy.title: Engage utility providers for capacity and extension feasibility

permitting-complexity-proxy.title: Map AHJ review path and long-lead approval milestones

logistics-access-proxy.title: Develop preliminary logistics and staging plan

contingencyBands.basis: Moderate-high risk mix across major cost categories
Some medium risk indicators with manageable controls

baselineBidAssumptions.title: Geotechnical Confirmation
baselineBidAssumptions.text: Pricing assumes geotechnical report confirms baseline bearing/subgrade conditions and no extraordinary remediation.

baselineBidAssumptions.title: Allowance - Subgrade/Drainage
baselineBidAssumptions.text: Carry owner allowance for subgrade stabilization/dewatering where soil or flood indicators are medium/high.

highFlood.title: Exclusion - Extraordinary Flood Mitigation
highFlood.text: Excludes extraordinary flood-control structures beyond code-minimum and civil documents at bid date.

highFire.title: Assumption - Fire Authority Requirements
highFire.text: Assumes AHJ and insurer wildfire hardening requirements are limited to currently issued standards.
